did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Office of Communications, Production, Art and Design, Photographs and Negatives, Office Files of Laura Walworth and Dayna Bealy

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in two series:

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This material was transferred to RAC in 2017 by the Ford Foundation and ingested by RAC as Accession 2017:093.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains photographs of grantees' activities used by the Ford Foundation for various publications, including annual reports, fall reports, winter reports, and Innovations in State and Local Government materials. The folder title typically indicates a Ford identification number, the name of the grantee or event photographed, the publication the photographs were intended for, the Ford Foundation unit responsible for the grant (for examples: Peace and Social Justice PSJ or Governance and Civil Society GCS), and the name of the photographer.
